pageTitle: Cumulative Update package 7 for SQL Server 2008 R2
textBeforeTable: Expand this table Collapse this table For more information about the SQL Server bugs, click the following article numbers to view the articles in the Microsoft Knowledge Base: Microsoft Knowledge Base articles that discuss these hotfixes will be released as they become available. Give Feedback | Back to the top loadTOCNode(2, 'moreinformation'); If you install Cumulative Update 7 for SQL Server 2008 R2 on a computer that has Visual Studio 2010 RTM installed, you may experience a loss of SQL IntelliSense features in Visual Studio. To resolve this issue, install Visual Studio 2010 Service Pack 1 (SP1). To download this service pack, visit the following Microsoft website: loadTOCNode(3, 'moreinformation');
textAfterTable: 658687 2504090 (https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2504090/ ) FIX: Access violation when you insert data into a new partition of a partitioned table after you drop a column of the table in SQL Server 2008 R2 693790 2506795 (https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2506795/ ) FIX: "Insufficient data for an Image" error when you open a .pdf file that is exported from a SQL Server 2008 Reporting Services or SQL Server 2008 R2 Reporting Services environment 663561 2506799 (https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2506799/ ) FIX: Performance decreases after you move a large report to SQL Server 2008 R2 Reporting Services 693793 2509659 (https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2509659/ ) FIX: The dbo schema is preappended when you use a custom stored procedure in the sp_addarticle stored procedure 693794 2510668 (https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2510668/ ) You can now use Package Installation Wizard (Dtsinstall.exe) to run the deployment manifest file of an SSIS package when SSIS 2008 or SSIS 2008 R2 is not installed 693779 2511151 (https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2511151/ ) FIX: Column of a Flat File source is not imported if the next column data is one byte longer than the output column
